headline: The Score: Pfizer, Tesla, Electronic Arts and More Stocks That Defined the Week
summary: Electronic Arts  is saying ”game over” to Wall Street in the largest leveraged buyout of all time.  The videogame maker said Monday that it would go private in a $55 billion megadeal with a group of investors including Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund, private-equity firm Silver Lake and  Jared Kushner’s  investment firm Affinity Partners.  EA publishes The Sims, football game Madden NFL and FC, the soccer videogame formerly known as FIFA.

headline: Why Saudi Arabia bought EA in world's biggest gaming deal
summary: From a $55 billion gaming takeover to the NFL’s surprising shake-ups, here’s what’s moving money and markets in the sports world. This week on Yahoo Finance Sports Report, host Joe Pompliano takes a look at some of this week’s biggest headlines in the sports business world that you and your portfolio need to know. From Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund leading a joint acquisition of Electronic Arts (EA) for $55 billion to the NBA selling their franchises in the Africa League and John Cena’s final WWE match, there’s plenty of money moves shaping the sports industry. Yahoo Sports Senior Reporter Frank Schwab joins the show to talk about the latest coming out of the latest in the NFL, including Jaxson Dart’s first game with the New York Giants, and why the initially favored Baltimore Ravens are sitting third in their division’s standings. Plus, NFL Vice President, Head of Flag Football Stephanie Kwok stops by the show to talk about the growth of the sport and teases what’s to come for the league ahead of the 2028 Olympics. Yahoo Finance Sports Report with Joe Pompliano, a vodcast brought to you by Yahoo Finance and Yahoo Sports, looks beyond the latest sports business headlines, analyzes all the need-to-know news - the teams, trades, and billion dollar deals - so you and your portfolio will win BIG. Yahoo Finance Sports Report is developed and produced by Lauren Pokedoff.

headline: How NBA’s Africa League shakeup could redefine basketball
summary: The NBA is making its boldest play yet in Africa that could reshape basketball forever. This week on Yahoo Finance Sports Report, host Joe Pompliano dives into the NBA’s bold plan to reshape its Basketball Africa League. He explains how selling all 12 teams to franchise owners could spark league growth, new markets, and arenas - marking a massive bet on basketball’s future. Pompliano also covers other major sports business headlines, from soaring MLB postseason ticket prices to the New England Patriots’ latest valuation and Saudi Arabia’s $55 billion takeover of Electronic Arts (EA). To hear more, check out this week’s episode of Yahoo Finance Sports report here.Yahoo Finance Sports Report with Joe Pompliano, a vodcast brought to you by Yahoo Finance and Yahoo Sports, looks beyond the latest sports business headlines, analyzes all the need-to-know news - the teams, trades, and billion dollar deals - so you and your portfolio will win BIG.Yahoo Finance Sports Report is developed and produced by Lauren Pokedoff.

headline: Public Bonds Are Booming. Why Is Private Credit Flashing Distress?
summary: Lower rates have spurred the sales of corporate bonds. But bankruptcies are a sign that not all is well in the more shadowy private credit world of bank loans and closed-end funds.

raw.headline: Public Bonds Are Booming. Why Is Private Credit Flashing Distress?
raw.summary: Lower rates have spurred the sales of corporate bonds. But bankruptcies are a sign that not all is well in the more shadowy private credit world of bank loans and closed-end funds.

headline: Electronic Arts (EA): Exploring Valuation as Shares Build Steady Momentum
summary: Electronic Arts (EA) shares have moved slightly in recent trading, drawing attention from investors looking for signals in its recent performance. The stock has seen steady gains over the past month and quarter, catching the eye of those tracking gaming sector trends. See our latest analysis for Electronic Arts. Zooming out, Electronic Arts’ share price momentum has been steady rather than spectacular. Recent gains have built calmly on the back of solid performance. Over the past year, total...

headline: Mohammed bin Salman’s ‘sportswashing’ has just gone virtual
summary: At a glitzy awards ceremony this summer, video gamers from Saudi esports group Team Falcons took to the stage to accept a trophy from a beaming Mohammed bin Salman, the country’s Crown Prince and de-facto ruler.
